description.narrative: Output 6.4: By 2018, children and adolescents, in particular the most vulnerable, have access to efficient civil registration services

sector.narrative: Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.4: By 2018, children and adolescents, in particular the most vulnerable, have access to efficient civil registration services

description.narrative: Civil registration services maintained their performance, although remuneration of village civil registration agents by the government remains a challenge. 53% of births expected in the first two quarters were declared within the deadlines of 1 month in rural areas and 10 days in urban areas | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

title.narrative: % of civil registration centres operational (registering and submitting declarations)
% of villages/tribes and health facilities established as civil registration centres
% of births registered within time limits
The computerisation of the Civil Registration and Vital Statistics including Birth registration is initiated.

Existence of a national civil registration and vital statistics strategy(ies) which reflects recent international standards and principles for CRVS systems and are in line with the human rights conventions and protocols ratified by the State
Country has an interoperable service delivery with Health
